org.apache.juneau.rest

Class StaticFileMapping

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.StaticFileMapping

  • public class StaticFileMapping
extends Object
    Static file mapping.

    Used to define paths and locations of statically-served files such as images or HTML documents.

    An example where this class is used is in the Rest.staticFiles() annotation:

    package com.foo.mypackage; @Rest( path="/myresource", staticFiles={"htdocs:docs"} ) public class MyResource extends BasicRestServlet {...}

    Static files are found by using the ClasspathResourceFinder defined on the resource.

    In the example above, given a GET request to /myresource/htdocs/foobar.html, the servlet will attempt to find the foobar.html file in the following ordered locations:

    1. com.foo.mypackage.docs package.
    2. org.apache.juneau.rest.docs package (since BasicRestServlet is in org.apache.juneau.rest).
    3. [working-dir]/docs directory.
    • Mappings are cumulative from parent to child. Child resources can override mappings made on parent resources.
    • The media type on the response is determined by the RestContext.getMediaTypeForName(String) method.
    • Overview > juneau-rest-server > Static files

    • Constructor Detail

      • StaticFileMapping

        public StaticFileMapping(Class<?> resourceClass,
                         String path,
                         String location,
                         Map<String,Object> responseHeaders)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        resourceClass - The resource/servlet class which serves as the base location of the location below.
        path - The mapped URI path.
        Leading and trailing slashes are trimmed.
        location - The location relative to the resource class.
        Leading and trailing slashes are trimmed.
        responseHeaders - The response headers. Can be null.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static List<StaticFileMapping> parse(Class<?> resourceClass,
                                            String mapping)
                                     throws ParseException
        Create one or more StaticFileMappings from the specified comma-delimited list of mappings.

        Mapping string must be one of these formats:

        • "path:location" (e.g. "foodocs:docs/foo")
        • "path:location:headers-json" (e.g. "foodocs:docs/foo:{'Cache-Control':'max-age=86400, public'}")
        Parameters:
        resourceClass - The resource/servlet class which serves as the base location of the location below.
        mapping - The mapping string that represents the path/location mapping.
        Leading and trailing slashes and whitespace are trimmed from path and location.
        Returns:
        A list of parsed mappings. Never null.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If mapping was malformed.
